headline.main: Patients, Too, Turn to the Internet for Fund-Raising

docs.abstract: Online fund-raising - a common tactic for nonprofit groups and charity events - is starting to spread to the world of costly health care.
docs.snippet: Online fund-raising - a common tactic for nonprofit groups and charity events - is starting to spread to the world of costly health care.

docs.lead_paragraph: On Jessica Haley's 28th birthday in June, she posted a wish on the fund-raising Web site IndieGoGo. Ms. Haley and her husband, Sean, of Melbourne, Fla., wanted a baby, but their insurance did not cover fertility treatment.

headline.main: Patients, Too, Turn to the Internet for Fund-Raising

headline.main: Better Health for the Nation's Truckers

docs.abstract: Beset by rising insurance costs and desperate to ensure their drivers pass government health tests, trucking companies and industry groups are working hard to persuade truckers to change their habits.
docs.snippet: Beset by rising insurance costs and desperate to ensure their drivers pass government health tests, trucking companies and industry groups are working hard to persuade truckers to change their habits.

docs.lead_paragraph: On the road for weeks on end, with poor diets and little exercise, the nation's truckers are in pretty bad shape, reports Abby Ellin in this week's Science Times.

headline.main: Better Health for the Nation's Truckers

docs.lead_paragraph: In Windsor Terrace, a cafe turns its space over to a wine bar for the evening hours.

headline.seo: In Windsor Terrace, a Cafe With a Split Personality
headline.main: At Night, a Cafe Reveals It Has a Split Personality
headline.print_headline: At Night, a Cafe Reveals It Has a Split Personality

docs.abstract: Crossroads Cafe in Windsor Terrace, Brooklyn, turns its space over to a wine bar for the evening hours, from Wednesday to Sunday; Jeremiah Fox, who operates Nanny Goat Hill like a pop-up restaurant, got the idea when he saw the cafe was closed at night.
docs.snippet: In Windsor Terrace, a cafe turns its space over to a wine bar for the evening hours.

docs.lead_paragraph: Its problems are profound, but beware of anyone promising quick fixes.
docs.abstract: Editorial contends that any substantial effort to reduce deficit must address soaring costs of Medicare, but says politicians are more concerned with leveraging ideological implications of the program than addressing its problems pragmatically; outlines number of potential reforms related to near-term costs, longer-term savings, fee-for-service model and regularization of benefits.
docs.snippet: Its problems are profound, but beware of anyone promising quick fixes.
